headline: Trump meets with Big Oil execs to talk Venezuela investments
summary: President Trump met with Big Oil executives at the White House on Friday in the hopes of securing $100 billion to invest in and revive Venezuela's oil (CL=F, BZ=F) industry. This comes a week after the US invaded Venezuela and captured President Nicolás Maduro. Breaking News Reporter Jake Conley comes on Market Domination to review what was on the meeting's agenda and break down Trump's plans for Venezuelan oil. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Trump meets with oil executives at the White House on Friday, seeking investments in Venezuela
summary: President Donald Trump is meeting with oil executives at the White House on Friday in hopes of securing $100 billion in investments to revive Venezuela’s ability to fully tap into its expansive reserves of petroleum — a plan that rides on their comfort in making commitments in a country plagued by instability, inflation and uncertainty.  Since the U.S. military raid to capture former Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro on Saturday, Trump has quickly pivoted to portraying the move as a newfound economic opportunity for the U.S., seizing three tankers carrying Venezuelan oil, saying the U.S. is taking over the sales of 30 million to 50 million barrels of previously sanctioned Venezuelan oil and will be controlling sales worldwide indefinitely.

raw.headline: Trump meets with oil executives at the White House on Friday, seeking investments in Venezuela
raw.summary: President Donald Trump is meeting with oil executives at the White House on Friday in hopes of securing $100 billion in investments to revive Venezuela’s ability to fully tap into its expansive reserves of petroleum — a plan that rides on their comfort in making commitments in a country plagued by instability, inflation and uncertainty.  Since the U.S. military raid to capture former Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro on Saturday, Trump has quickly pivoted to portraying the move as a newfound economic opportunity for the U.S., seizing three tankers carrying Venezuelan oil, saying the U.S. is taking over the sales of 30 million to 50 million barrels of previously sanctioned Venezuelan oil and will be controlling sales worldwide indefinitely.

headline: Trump Says Oil Majors Will Invest $100 Billion in Venezuela
summary: President Trump said early Friday that American oil companies would pour $100 billion of investment into Venezuela to jumpstart its oil industry. Trump's social-media post came hours before he is expected to meet representatives of Chevron, Exxon Mobil, ConocoPhillips and other oil companies at the White House to discuss investing in Venezuela.

headline: Trump's Venezuela Meeting Is Shaping Up to Be a Who's Who of US Oil
summary: Nearly 20 oil executives, including veteran wildcatter Harold Hamm, are slated to meet President Donald Trump and top officials at the White House Friday as the administration pushes them to rebuild Venezuela’s battered energy sector.  The scheduled lineup is a Who’s Who of American oil titans, with representatives from Chevron Corp., Exxon Mobil Corp., ConocoPhillips and other companies responding to Trump’s call to discuss potentially reviving Venezuela’s production, which has plummeted amid years of disrepair, fading investment and the exodus of foreign companies.

raw.headline: Trump's Venezuela Meeting Is Shaping Up to Be a Who's Who of US Oil
raw.summary: Nearly 20 oil executives, including veteran wildcatter Harold Hamm, are slated to meet President Donald Trump and top officials at the White House Friday as the administration pushes them to rebuild Venezuela’s battered energy sector.  The scheduled lineup is a Who’s Who of American oil titans, with representatives from Chevron Corp., Exxon Mobil Corp., ConocoPhillips and other companies responding to Trump’s call to discuss potentially reviving Venezuela’s production, which has plummeted amid years of disrepair, fading investment and the exodus of foreign companies.

headline: Why Trump Underestimates the Challenge of Reviving Venezuela’s Oil
summary: Venezuela’s oil sector is deeply degraded, with production far below capacity and infrastructure in “catastrophic” condition.
